properties.name: AMP Event JSON

properties.description: This workflow uses the global table with encoded API credentials for the added AMP and Umbrella MSSP customers.  It will loop through these API keys and obtain the AMP events for the past 5 minutes. This workflow can be scheduled to run every 5 minutes. It is also possible to configure which events are deemed as important to retrieve. The suggestion is to retrieve only high priority events, such as events with a `HIGH` or `CRITICAL` severity. This workflow will then create a SecureX incident, as well as a ServiceNow incident.

actions.name: Threat Response v2 - Inspect for Observables
actions.title: Threat Response v2 - Inspect for Observables

properties.display_name: Threat Response v2 - Inspect for Observables

properties.script:
import sys, json
from urllib.parse import quote

securex_tr_base_url = "https://visibility.amp.cisco.com/investigate?q="
securex_tr_relative_url = ""
observables_string = ""

observables = json.loads(sys.argv[1])

for observable in observables:
    securex_tr_relative_url =  f"{securex_tr_relative_url}{observable['type']}={observable['value']}&"
    observables_string = (f"{observables_string}{observable['type']}:\"{observable['value']}\",")

securex_tr_relative_url_encoded = quote(securex_tr_relative_url)

securex_tr_encoded_url = securex_tr_base_url + securex_tr_relative_url_encoded

properties.script:
from urllib.parse import quote
import sys

json = sys.argv[1]
url_encoded_json = quote(json)
response_id  = sys.argv[2]
split_response_id = response_id.split("/")
relative_url = "respond/trigger/" + split_response_id[0] + "/" + split_response_id[1] + "?observable_type=ip&observable_value=" + url_encoded_json + "&workflow_id=" + split_response_id[1]
